characters: ERICSON KICKS IN THE BACK DOOR. GUN READY
STARGHER KING CLAMPS HIS MASSIVE ARMS AROUND THE CHILD
WINCH'S MOTOR IS A WORN PLAQUE READING "CARVER INDUSTRIAL
PICTURE AND SOUND DISTORT AND CHANGE

dialogues.speaker: A SPECK OF DUST
dialogues.text: Grains of sand dance in the wind.  As we glide over a VAS DESERT, the speck of dust becomes a HORSE AND RIDER.  CATHERINE YOUNG straddles the beautiful black animal, her mesmerizing eyes scanning the horizon.  A curious breeze blows across her exquisite face and she drinks it in, as the wind itself were telling something to her... Catherine sees a FLICKERING LIGHT in the sand.  She pulls reins and the horse stops moments before the dune drops i nothingness.  She dismounts, affectionately scratches the horse's neck, and follows the LIGHT.  When she looks over shoulder, the Arabian is now a child's WOODEN HOBBY HORSE Not surprised, Catherine smiles and walks down a dune, sa sliding beneath her feet... She finds herself in a valley of dead trees whose decayed gnarled limbs appear to form hands.  The light dances acr her face.  She shades her eyes and pinpoints the source.. A SMALL MIRROR reflecting rays of bright sun, housed with locket and chain.  It's held by EDWARD, a haunted-looking of seven with a precocious grin and piercing eyes.  He si on a fallen tree trunk, patiently waiting for her arrival

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the horse. He's a shy child, yet comfortable with Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You liked him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's beautiful... Edward smiles, delighted he made her happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought we were going sailing. The boy frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promised. A devilish glint in his eye, Edward redirects the mirror. Catherine follows the flicker to a TOY BOAT in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't fit into that! Edward shines light in her eyes, momentarily blinding her then snaps the locket shut.  When her vision clears, Catherine sees a GIANT SHIP perched among the dunes.  A c weighing hundreds of tons just sitting there in the deser

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll do. She walks toward it, but Edward doesn't follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coaxing him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Mister E. She extends her hand, but he adamantly shakes his head no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods at the ship)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 's broken. Undaunted, she... finds herself standing on the DECK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mocky-Lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no... No you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Mocky-Lock is the bogeyman.  Mocky-Lock wants me where I am."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet we can fix it. She opens a rusted iron DOOR.  It makes an HORRIFIC SCREECHING SOUND.  Similar to metal-on-metal, but more piercing, more pained.  As if made by a living thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (familiar with the noise, a warning to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed-ward... The boy's FACE CONTORTS, turning into something half-huma half-animal.  A monster.  Mocky-Lock.  He SCREECHES, tryi to frighten Catherine, but she cocks her head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We agreed.  No more Mocky-Lock. The creature sticks its tongue out and DIVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward! But it's too late!  Edward/Mocky Lock slithers into the s and disappears.  Resigning herself to a failure, she open the palm of her left hand, revealing a SMALL BUMP in the flesh between thumb and forefinger.  She presses hard and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking at a large SCREEN showing an electronicall generated three-dimensional view of a human brain featuri color-coded neurological activity.  In a specific section the image, cells flash from yellow to red... PULL BACK TO REVEAL HENRY WEST surrounded by computers, monitors, electronics, and keyboards.  DR. MIRIAM KENT st before a peculiar diagnostic machine scrutinizing data an images.  Both wear garb favored by surgeons or microchip assemblers.  The impressive, weird computer system HUMS a shifts programs, the unusual brain image changing colors. THROUGH A LARGE WINDOW, we see into an ADJOINING ROOM wit which a HUMAN FIGURE hangs suspended in mid-air by a seri of cables designed to simulate flotation. AT THE CONSOLE, Miriam uses a pen to hit specific areas o the touch-sensitive screen, changing the complex CHEMICAL SYMBOLS displayed there. IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, a series of pharmaceuticals are injected into an intravenous tube feeding the sleeve/arm the figure.  A featherweight cloth MASK electronically ri revealing the sleeping face of Catherine. AT THE CONSOLE, Miriam hits a button and speaks into an intercom microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sing a song of sixpence... IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, there is no reaction from Catherin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sing a song of sixpence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse, groggy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pocketful of rye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four-and-twenty blackbirds. Catherine's eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baked in a pie... IN THE CONTROL ROOM, Henry hits a switch and Catherine is lowered to the pedestal.  Miriam checks Monitors displayi Catherine's vital signs and continuing what must be a routine, presses numbers on a keypad to open the PRESSURI AIRTIGHT DOOR separating the two areas. IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, lights come on and Miriam eases Catherine out of the apparatus.  She checks her pupil dilation, pulse, throat, and reflexes.  She pokes and pro with a familiarity that would seem rude to an outside observer, but is nothing to them.  Getting to her feet, w see that Catherine's BODYSUIT is made of an unusual dark fabric almost liquid in consistency. AT THE CONSOLE, Henry moves to another section and for th first time, we see there are two elaborate neural monitor And the "brain" pictured here is smaller.  Younger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Mister E." is doing fine. REVEAL A SECOND FIGURE suspended from the ceiling in the PROCEDURE ROOM.  A SMALL BOY is lowered to the pedestal a as Miriam records data, Catherine removes the child's "ma displaying the haunted face of Edward.  Clearly, the boy in some kind of catatonic state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we go sailing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost.  Mocky-Lock showed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Mocky-Lock is the bogeyman, Mocky-Lock wants me where I am."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mocky-Lock is a pain in the ass. Henry communicates with them via the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did that come from again? Catherine looks annoyed - How could he forget?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nursery rhyme. Catherine detaches the cables and eases Edward's frail bo into a waiting wheelchair.  Miriam takes a penlight and examines the boy's eyes... An emotionless void, oddly beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking aloud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nursery rhymes, fairy tales, the bogeyman... All preparation for the horrors of the real world. Making certain the child is comfortable, Catherine covers with a blanket, rests a teddy bear on his lap, and pushes into the CONTROL ROOM, accompanied by Miriam.  Henry type a command and moves to join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody hungry?  I'm hungry... A BUZZER sounds and ANOTHER DOOR HISSES OPEN... A constan fretting administrator, BARRY COOPERMAN, is waiting for t in the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward's parents are here. We can see it in Catherine's face - this isn't good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Situated in a corporate/industrial area north of San Dieg California, a series of well-secured buildings form a min compound.  A sign near the gate reads CAMPBELL CENTER - A DIVISION OF SUNERSET INDUSTRIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although this is a hospital room filled with medical equipment, its sterility has been camouflaged with toys, posters, photographs, and drawings to make it more "homey (Some hint at aspects of Edward's fantasy world).  Every comfort has been provided and no expense spared. Henry, Miriam, and Catherine, now wearing funky/casual clothes under a lab coat, stand opposite Cooperman.  Sitt on the bed with Edward is ELLA BAINES, an elegantly dress woman in her mid-40's.  There is a soulfulness to her, bu the husband, LUCIEN BAINES, 60's, possesses the icy demea of a corporate tycoon.  One might write him off as cold, we sense a genuine love for his wife and child.  Ella smi and caresses Edward's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs a haircut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell the nurse. (sensing something in Edward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, he loves when you visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband wonders if that's true. (delivering bad news)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to place Edward in a hospital. Seeing an unfunded future, Henry's ready to disassociate himself from Miriam and Catherine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are other applications for the scanner, Mr. Baines...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize that, Henry... (to Miriam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I know your work, Dr. Kent, is invaluable to this company...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know about me, though, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine, we've waited eighteen months for signs of progress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's been progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but there is no proof the procedure works.  All I have is a belief that your interaction with my son is not a hallucination. Catherine is hurt and vulnerable due to exhaustion and th intensity of her experience with Edward, but feels she mu defend herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cooperman, Miriam, Henry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You picked me, remember?  And I took the job.  Gladly.  This is the next wave and I want to be part of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one is doubting your ability.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what is it? Introspective and solemn-eyed, Lucien takes a moment, the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've invested millions of dollars in this study... And I've convinced others to do the same.  I suppose I should feel responsible to them, but I don't.  I could care less if they see a profit.  I'm responsible to my boy, that's all that matters. (looks her in the eye)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me... Am I doing the right thing? OFF CATHERINE'S FACE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first, we're not sure where we are or what's happening It's too bright, the space confining.  As our eyes adjust seem to be in a bathroom or shower stall.  We HEAR a WOMA CRYING and the camera finds ANNE VICKSEY.  Dark circles beneath eyes red and puffy from crying.  Hair wet and rat Sweater and pants damp and stained.  Barefoot, she shiver from cold and fear... PULL BACK to show more of her surroundings.  The white-ti 10' x 8' room features a SHOWER HEAD, TOILET, and a push button SPIGOT for drinking water.  Two walls are SOLID, t other two MIRRORED, the glass covered by thick clear plas The floor is littered with empty food wrappers - candy ba juice boxes.  In the center of the floor is a DRAIN and a her, on the ceiling, a FLUORESCENT LAMP, also encased in clear plastic. There is no door. A mechanism CLICKS. Then a RUMBLING... Anne seems to know what's coming.  She presses against the wall, removes her arms from the sleeves of the sweater, hunches down, and raises the garment over her head, forming a tent. WATER ERUPTS from the shower head.  There is no steam, so this water must be cold.  Shaking, Anne whispers a count herself - "One-one thousand, two-one thousand, three..." so on.  The spray hits everything in the room - mirror, toilet, floor - and a food wrapper drifts toward the drai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty. She peeks up from the tent, but the water has not stopped and that isn't what she expected.  We hear a soft SUCKING NOISE and a CLICK.  The wrapper rises on a puddle of wate Anne POUNDS her fist on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry, scared)

dialogues.speaker: THIRTY
dialogues.text: A puddle forms around her feet and she realizes the drain somehow been sealed shut.  Her panic intensifies as we he another CLICK and the water pressure increases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkened procedure room, Miriam finds Catherine standing between the two suspension devices, alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? Catherine turns, nods, and tries to smile.  Has she been crying?  Miriam steps further into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hates me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucien Baines? Catherine nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't say "hates."  Dislikes, distrusts, maybe. Catherine laughs.  Exactly what Miriam wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She adores you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks I can bring Edward back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday you can.  We all believe that... Catherine halfheartedly nods, but her mind is elsewhere, focused on the two apparatuses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to try it.  Please. Miriam knows what this is about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been over this a dozen times.  No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?  Just once.  A trial run.  What harm could it do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to find out. Ever the doctor, Miriam finds herself surreptitiously examining Catherine's eyes, flesh tone, a slight tremblin her fingertips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it taking so long for us to reach him?  Because we've been reactive, that's why.  And we need to be active. Miriam reaches for Catherine's wrist and takes her pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miriam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shush. As Miriam examines her, Catherine continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He creates the obstacles, he decides which games to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard this argument before.  It's not happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could take years for me to get past the barriers he's created.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we reverse the feed and bring Edward into your mind, it could be devastating for him.  Imagine the shock of suddenly existing in a whole other world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do it all the time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but, you're a willing participant.  Picture Edward in a strange place, lost, frightened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be there for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he might blame you for terrifying him.  That one moment could erase all you've accomplished.  And if that happened, the trust he has in you is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defeated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... Miriam takes a penlight and examines Catherine's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I don't know what it might do to you.  You're already exhausted. (concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been sleeping? Catherine nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can prescribe something... Catherine shakes her head no.  Miriam shuts off the penli and looks at Catherine with professional and personal concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure?  Any more nightmares?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  We need you healthy and relaxed.  You're going to eat well, meditate, exercise, and watch mindless television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you up all night reading Edward's case file of the nine millionth time.  Balance, dear girl, is the key.  Leave the work here. She taps Catherine's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bring it home in this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Miriam gathers her belongings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry wants me to try this Vietnamese place he's wild about.  Want to come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (declining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to feed my cat.  Besides, I want to get to bed early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my girl. Miriam exits, but Catherine remains, still curious what c happen if things were reversed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corridors are dark and most everyone has gone home. the NURSES STATION, a staff member observes the child on closed-circuit monitor.  Further down the hall, Miriam an Henry exit.  Wearing a (chic) thrift store coat and luggi worn book bag, Catherine stands outside Edward's room, watching him sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasant dreams, Mister E.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GREEN FORD PICK-UP TRUCK cruises down this deserted str of two-lane blacktop, the driver carefully maintaining th speed limit.  He signals and exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck rumbles along a stretch of bumpy, unpaved road. The area is desolate, depressing, and deserted.  It feels like no one's been anywhere near here for years.  The pic stops at a RUSTED GATE and the DRIVER, a tall, lean, sine fellow undoes a combination lock-and-chain.  We do not ye see his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck parks inside a charred barn, now hidden from vi and the driver steps out, followed by his DOG. A magnificent WHITE GERMAN SHEPHERD.  We notice a GLINT i its BLUE EYES - the animal's an albino.  The driver point and whistles.  Well-trained, the Shepard sprints to the g and waits, keeping a watchful eye on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the outside, a passerby would never know this sanctu existed.  Within the foundation of a farm building never completed, we find a small room in the center of a much larger space.  The cell.  We hear the WHIR of ELECTRONIC EQUIPMENT and notice VIDEO CAMERAS mounted on tripods poi at the two-way glass.  We follow CABLES to a massive VIDE RECORDER - the type used in surveillance, able to record days without maintenance, and an elaborate TIMING DEVICE connected to a series of VALVES and SWITCHES. As if in a beatific trance, the driver moves to the windo and gently rests his palm on the glass.  ANNE MOVES!  Arm flailing, mouth gasping, eyes filled with dread.  The las spark of life... The driver JUMPS, startled and frightene Almost shamefully, he turns and hides, unable to look at Suddenly, his body tenses and writhes, as if seized by torturous pain.  He opens his mouth in a silent scream. And then, quickly as it came, the pain subsides.  Hidden shadow, he breathes deeply, regaining self-control.  He waits, then moves back to the glass.  Anne's dead face fl past him.  Almost angelic.  He watches her and leans his against the window, closer.  And the driver catches his o reflection in the mirror. Meet CARL STARGHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small and isolated, the nearest neighbor a block away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is a mess.  Computer print-outs, dirty dishes, unopened mail, videotapes, and notepads cover tables, cha and floor.  On the crammed bookshelves, psychology texts next to volumes on mythology, religion, and the occult.  Totems, figurines and artifacts (Central and South Americ in origin) adorn the walls and tables. As Portishead plays on the stereo, we find Catherine suffering from insomnia, wearing goofy-yet-hip eyeglasses sweatpants and a UCSD T-shirt, sharing a late-night snack with her pet CAT.  She shuts the refrigerator door and we linger on an odd POSTCARD taped to the surface.  A kitsch postcard of a warrior/goddess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We MOVE out of shadow, toward a bright focused light, following the albino German Shepherd - VALENTINE - as it enters a VAST SUBTERRANEAN ROOM.  Most of the walls have knocked down, leaving only thick support posts.  Valentin finds Stargher in a DUGOUT PIT - about five feet deeper t the rest of the room - polishing a stainless steel table. bright tungsten work light hangs above, and near it is th chain, cables and hooks of a customized MECHANICAL HOIST. The dog picks up an unpleasant scent and follows it to a corner where there are empty jugs of BLEACH sitting next long, deep cast iron TUB.  Stargher WHISTLES and Valentin obediently retreats to a KENNEL CAGE.  Stargher gives him chew toy and locks the dog inside before moving to the tu Soaking in the bleach is the nude corpse of Anne Vicksey. The interior of the tub is glazed with gleaming porcelain the whiteness of her flesh makes it appear as though she floating in nothingness, but what hypnotizes and appalls her eyes.  Wide open, transformed by the chlorine into something ghostly, they are unforgettable. As the bleach gurgles down the drain, Stargher lifts Anne from the tub and carries her to the table.  He places her face up and dries her with a clean white towel.  He moves limbs, lips, hips, and hands into desired positions then retreats into shadow.  In the harsh light, against the sh table, the bleached body has the quality of an apparition we almost expect her to move... We HEAR Stargher remove his clothes and he steps into the pool of light.  Nude, we see that his lean, muscular fram laced with some rough tatoos.  When he turns his back to we find EIGHT METAL RINGS, thick and strong, PIERCED thro his flesh.  Two columns of four on either side of the spi running from shoulder blade to just below the waist.  Wha God's name are they for? Stargher shuts off the work light and moves to an area wh he keeps TELEVISION MONITORS and VCRs.  He inserts a videocassette taken from the surveillance deck and watche the screen. In BLACK AND WHITE, we see Anne awaken in the cell.  Her first moments inside.  Disoriented, terrified, trapped, s examines her surroundings. Stargher is mesmerized by her fear.  Fast-forwarding to h death, he presses a remote and we get SOUND.  Anne scream begging for her life.  Aroused, stimulated, Stargher drin it in like a symphony.  Valentine cowers in the back of h cage, hating this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying on her bed (a waterbed), Catherine sleepily stares the ceiling, rolls onto her side, and feels herself drawn into the comforter.  The folds of the fabric become rippl Ripples become dunes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we find ourselves in the DESERT of EDWARD'S WORLD. We fly over dunes and come up behind Catherine as she struggles through waves of sand.  The tree trunk is up ah and we glimpse someone hiding inside. Catherine reaches.  MOCKEY-LOCK ERUPTS FROM WITHIN THE TR TRUNK!  SNARLING!  Catherine retreats, silently screaming

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN HER OWN BED, Catherine's eyes are open.  In sharp cont to a typical reaction to a nightmare, she remains calm. sweaty face, no gasp, no reaction at all, really.  She mi as well have been dreaming of puppy dogs.  Wide awake, he eyes return their gaze to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.  To.  Sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAINS attached to bizarre HOOKS dangle from the ceiling. Admiring Anne's body, Stargher links the hooks to the rin in his back.  He presses a remote unit and up in the raft a series of GEARS click into motion.  The sound is tortur as the mechanical hoist LIFTS Stargher off the ground, pulling at the rings, strips of flesh rising.  Stargher grimaces, but clearly he wants the pain, needs it.  As th hoist clicks into another gear, it carries Stargher over table until his body is perfectly positioned above Anne's In the flickering weird light of the television screen, Stargher resembles something from the twisted imagination William Blake - a levitating demon ready to debauch an innocent angel.  With his free hand, he touches himself, chains clinking and swaying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A railroad bridge and highway span an almost-bone-dry cre bed.  Gathered beneath the overpass are the POLICE, CORON CRIMINIALISTS, AND A LOCAL FBI.  A SEDAN travels down a service road and stops nearby.  TWO MEN exit, identify themselves as FBI and move to the crime scene. Special Agent GORDON RAMSEY is well-groomed, prides himse on professionalism, and follows the Bureau party line.  Special Agent PETER NOVAK is rough around the edges, introspective, and intense.  A loner who marches to the t of a peculiar drummer, he's unconventionally handsome wit probing eyes.  He moves slowly, observing the scene - the world, for that matter - from a unique perspective. As Ramsey finds the FBI's local liaison - AGENT COLE - No oblivious to the people around him, touches dirt, smells air, and examines road, river, bridge and sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who found her? Cole nods at a visibly shaken WORKMAN seated in a patrol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surveyor for the railroad... 'Bout six this morning. Novak sees a FEMALE BODY wrapped in plastic and bound by wire.  Supervising the examination of the woman is FBI PATHOLOGIST DR. THEODORE "TEDDY" LEE, a polite, dapper southern gentleman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for waiting, Teddy. Teddy gives Novak a friendly, respectful salute - "My pleasure."  Novak dons gloves, nods to an FBI PHOTOGRAPHE and assists Teddy Lee in snipping wire and peeling back t clear plastic.  As the photographer reacts to a strong sm Teddy comments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleach. As the man snaps pictures, Ramsey and Cole join them.  Sa Novak recognizes the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne Marie Vicksey. We recognize her, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She the one from Santa Cruz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just graduated law school.  Single mom.  Had a two-year-old daughter. He and Teddy expose the bleached flesh of her torso, neit man surprised.  Coldly thorough, Novak finds another of t killer's tell-tale signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (instructing the photographer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The semen on her legs and abdomen. FLASH! Photos are taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone looking after her little girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandparents.  Live over in Davis. Novak looks into the dead white eyes of Anne Vicksey, try to imagine the horrors she beheld.  He moves to the creek sees only a few inches of water.  His eyes move from the site to the highway above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The poor thing. FLASH!  We're up there now, ON THE OVERPASS, with the photographer and Novak, examining TIRE TRACKS in the soft shoulder.  Novak peers over the edge at the crime scene, steps back, and focuses on the highway - imagining the killer's truck as it disappeared into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PRETTY YOUNG WOMAN, JULIA HICKSON, shares lunch with he fiancee, JOHN TRACY.  They talk, laugh and kiss, not a ca in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As TALK RADIO plays, Carl Stargher watches them, specific Julia, his eyes never off her for too long as his hands w on something banal but unseen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...complaining about government subsidies for farmers... The voice on the radio becomes DISTORTED as we hear it through Stargher's ears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but without subsidies, families will starve, and I'm nodd exagggeerrrrr....ayding.  Iff id werrrr up tooooo meeeee..... The host's voice fades into a guttural, monstrous groan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeeee gawwwwwdd Caaaarrrrlll.  Mee god cum... (returning to normal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeeee....wwuuuuuddunnnnttttt... be spending billions on other countries when we've got problems right here. He opens his eyes and watches John kiss Julia goodbye as returns to work.  Stargher looks down and we see what he' been working on - A TOY DOLL.  Female.  Stripped of its clothes, a single metal ring stuck through its plastic ne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His lunch finished, Ramsey is on a cell-phone talking to wife.  Chain-drinking coffee, Novak scrutinizes photos of tire tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, honey, what's worse?  Doing it yourself or asking your mother for help? (gets his answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can it wait 'til I get back/ (listens, answers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea, Jeannie. Novak checks his watch and the street.  Clearly waiting f someone or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well all right.  Good luck with the Monster.  I love you too.  Bye-bye. Ramsey snaps shut the cell-phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We call Jeannie's mother "The Monster" because, well... she just is. Novak is oblivious, pouring over tire-related info.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you could care less about my personal life, Peter, but I do appreciate the occasional, "How's your wife, Gordon?" He waits.  Novak obliges:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pregnant.  Thanks for asking. Novak is distracted by Teddy Lee entering the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, man, I give up.  Your partner tells you his wife's gonna have a baby, and all you care about is a coroner's report! Ramsey assesses the exhausted, lonely, intense man sittin across from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel for those girls too, Pete.  And their families.  But it's just a job.  Someday it'll be over.  And then what'll you have? Much to Novak's appreciation, Teddy Lee's arrival provide escape from answering the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot off the presses. He gives them copies of the AUTOPSY REPORT and FORENSIC ANALYSIS of Anne Marie Vicksey.  The WAITRESS sees Teddy, approaches, and offers a menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't need it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicken fried steak, mashed potatoes, garden salad with Thousand Island dressing and an iced-tea.  Thank you darlin'. She nods and moves to the kitchen.  Novak and Ramsey flip through the documents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water in her lungs.  Same brand of bleach.  Match on the semen.  Lots of hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unenthused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More hair.  I could knit this guy a toupee. Novak finds something in the report that catches him by surprise.  He double-checks and shows the item to Teddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne Vicksey didn't own a dog. Ramsey checks his copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MONITOR shows a SINGLE HAIR under a video microscope.  Teddy Lee plays with the dials and gets a spectral view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Complete absence of melanin. Novak and Ramsey stand over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that means? Teddy moves aside and takes another bite of his lunch (chicken fried steak now carry-out).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog's an albino. (pictures it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd love an animal like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I believe an albino dog is rare indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exiting an elevator, Julia heads for her little Toyota.  Smart girl that she is, her eyes scan the area and her fingers hold a can of mace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia climbs in, checks her mirror and backs up.  WHAM! she hit something??  She brakes, puts the car in park, an checks her sideview mirror. Reflected there is a WOUNDED DOG.  A white German Shepher She rolls down her window and can hear the poor thing whimpering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia exits her car and kneels next to Valentine, who app to be in terrible pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God... I didn't see you. STARGHER'S HANDS COME AT HER FROM BEHIND!  One grabs her and the other covers her face with a chloroform-soaked to He presses so hard, she cannot scream, cannot move.  Afte brief struggle, he SHOVES her into her car and holds her until she passes out.  Stargher pushes Julia into the passenger seat and starts the car.  Pulls a dog treat fro his pocket and WHISTLES.  The Shepherd instantly perks up Perfectly healthy.  And jumps into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feeds him a treat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a BRIEFING ROOM we find Teddy Lee, Ramsey, Cole and lo cops.  All in need of caffeine.  They complain, gossip, a shoot the shit.  Resembling a demanding professor, Novak enters and through presence alone, lacking any self consciousness about his dishevelled appearance, takes con of the room by holding up a PHOTOGRAPH of a young woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donna Krozin. (a new picture every time)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen Francis, Teresa Manicki... The chatter dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Antoinette Simms, Natalie Pagels, Grace Cassatt... Anne Vicksey. Every person is solemn and focused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smart, gentle, attractive young women.  Just starting out in life.  Embarking on careers, going to school, getting married... He's hooked them.  The victims, these women, now mean something to them.  With great effect, he holds up grisly post-mortem photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were killed.  Kidnapped, tortured, and murdered.  By a white male.  About 30-years old. (significantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who owns an albino dog./ Everyone knows this is a real clue and awareness is heightened.  Ramsey chimes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A purebred German Shepherd. Novak shows them a picture of a WHITE GERMAN SHEPHERD tak from a resource on the Internet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breeders typically destroy albino pups, so this animal is truly unique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole Labetzki.  Victim seven.  Forensics found dog hair in her car, but they had a K-9 unit at the scene and never had it checked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Phoenix office tested that hair thirty minutes ago.  And we got the match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his dog. Ramsey holds up a thick list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Registered breeders of German Shepherds. The list is long and a few of the cops GROAN.  Novak sile them with a fierce look that says, "I will not rest until this man is found and neither should you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be thorough, but be fast.  This guy's accelerating.  He only waited six days this last time.  When he started, two months could pass. A DESK SEARGENT enters the room and hands a FAX to Ramsey Novak is curious about it, but continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can mean different things.  He thinks we're stupid and can't catch him.  He's having fun and needs more.  Or... (thinking it through)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This dog hair thing is sloppy.  The body this morning was found in less than three inches of water.  He knew we'd find her.  He wants to be caught.  But if we can't stop him... Gravely concerned, Ramsey moves across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dreading what's on that fax)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he can't stop himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stargher, the awful PAIN eating away at his skull.  He searches the medicine chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me god feed on pain. The VOICE echoing inside his skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pain good.  Cumm home to meee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struggling to stay on his feet, he moves to the KITCHEN.  Valentine paces nervously, whimpering concern.  Stargher reaches for a bottle of vodka but falls to the floor.  Valentine BARKS, but gets no reaction from master.  We MO IN on Stargher's unblinking eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go sleep Carl.  Me god wake up now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia Hickson finds the snack foods, drinking spigot, toi shower, and drain.  Her bare feet try to adjust to the ti floor, but it's fucking cold.  She glimpses herself in th mirror and is startled by what she sees - a terrified gir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TAN SEDAN sits in the driveway of this modest middle-cl home.  A VENTURA COUNTY SHERIFF'S CAR sits nearby, a depu keeping watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distraught middle-aged couple, MR. AND MRS. HICKSON, si the couch of their living room.  FAMILY PHOTOS show them Julia, whose fiancee, John, does his best to comfort the mother.  Novak and Ramsey have the unfortunate task of interviewing them about their daughter's disappearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was still living at home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were looking at apartments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (important they know)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But nobody was moving in together 'til after the wedding. Novak hasn't said much.  Instead, he looks at something i his hands - a plastic evidence bag containing the TOY DOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, you came to pick her up when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight o'clock.  We were going out for my birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you made a mistake.  Maybe she... she... Novak hides the doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir.  I'm sorry. Ramsey's cell-phone rings and he excuses himself to a cor of the room, leaving Novak alone to deal with this uncomfortable, sad situation, no one saying a word until emotionally shattered Mrs. Hickson, fingering a rosary, f compelled to tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After three years she remembers what the guy drove?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She remembers because it was her "dream truck."  Wanted one just like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramsey and Novak exit a small jet and are met by FBI Agen STOCKWELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramsey, Novak? They nod and he directs them to a waiting GMC SUBURBAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Stockwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edison.  Just east of Loma Park.  SWAT's had the house under surveillance for about twenty minutes. (info memorized)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suspect is Carl Rudolph Stargher.  No registered weapons, no priors.  Got a license for his dog, though.  Named him Valentine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stockwell is behind the wheel, racing down the highway.  Ramsey's in the passenger seat, Novak in back.  Shotguns body armor line the cargo area.  Novak's eyes target the a copy of Stargher's license and registration, and the gr dot-matrix image of the suspect's face.  And Novak knows found him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the bad man, aren't you, Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sparsely populated lower-middle class neighborhood.  A dozen plain houses at the end of a cul-de-sac.  Bare tree Brown lawns.  Crows in the air. The house furthest from the main road has a white Ford F2 pick-up in the driveway.  Green trim. THE SUBURBAN, hidden from Stargher's house, four-wheels i through a prairie and stops outside the backyard of a PRESCHOOL, where two more Suburbans and a van already wai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stockwell introduces Ramsey and Novak to BROCK, leader of FBI Tactical Unit, a calm, confident ex-Marine wearing a black uniform and body armor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad you could make it.  We lose the sun in half an hour. Novak and Ramsey join him at the shaded window to observe Stargher's house.  Children's drawings fill the wall.  As Brock explains, Novak checks with binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perimeter's two-hundred yards around the house.  Three men at the rear, two on each side, four up front.  I've got two marksmen on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have they seen him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  There's been movement in the kitchen.  But it could be the dog. (important)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think she's in there? Novak is careful with his answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We proceed assuming she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's give old Carl a call.  Tell him he's got company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (to Brock)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get a man close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet.  Calm.  And then we catch a glimpse of a FIGURE advancing, using any cover he can, until he is right outs the house.  The sneaky SWAT team member, ERICSON, whisper into his throat mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Ericson's earpiece)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the kitchen. Ericson maneuvers his way to the kitchen window and uses MIRROR to sneak a peek.  In the REFLECTION we see a motionless man lying on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a man down.  Repeat, man down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stargher? Ericson chances a quick visual check and pops his head up before reporting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't see his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brock looks to Novak, urgency and tension mounting.  Nova knows how much is riding on this specific moment.  All th various outcomes.  And decides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT TEAM SWARMS towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: FBI
dialogues.text: He and THREE OTHERS rush inside! BAM!  FOUR MEN KICK in and proceed through the FRONT DOOR

dialogues.speaker: FBI
dialogues.text: An odd quiet is all they encounter.  IN THE BACK, Ericson moves through a LAUNDRY ROOM and finds VALENTINE hiding behind a pile of dirty clothes, frightened by these maske figures in black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into throat mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got the dog! He points for someone to secure the animal and MOVES into KITCHEN, aiming his gun at the man on the floor, finally getting a look at his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recognizing him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl Stargher!  Do not move! No problem there.  Stargher appears lifeless.  As various SWAT team members secure the house, Ericson removes his m and CUFFS Stargher, startled at the sight of the horrible RINGS piercing his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As an AMBULANCE emerges from a hiding place behind anothe garage, we FOLLOW NOVAK and RAMSEY as they run from the preschool into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a K-9 UNIT secures Valentine, Novak storms into the kitchen, checks Stargher for a pulse and barks at SWAT&gt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paramedics.  NOW. Ramsey pushes through and Novak informs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI AGENTS and local police cordon off the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine is muzzled and led away as the PARAMEDICS load Stargher onto a stretcher.  Agent Stockwell turns to a worried Novak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll take him to County General.  Reid's already there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure he stays cuffed.  Two men on him at all times.  I don't want anyone treating him but Reid.  Not so much as a thermometer up his ass.  Understand? Stockwell nods and follows the stretcher outside.  A stoi Ramsey enters from the living room and Novak can see the disappointment in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not here. Novak would give anything for that not to be true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (it gets worse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should come downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramsey leads Novak into Stargher's "workroom."  It's all here, the table, the piercing supplies, the bleach.  An o grisly collection of DOLLS fills cubby holes in a wooden storage/shelf unit.  Novak's eyes are like a camera, documenting and storing as much information as possible, it's overwhelming. He moves through the basement.  Careful not to touch anything.  He stops and focuses on the hoist and eight ho situated over the stainless steel table.  (NOTE: ON THE

dialogues.speaker: WINCH'S MOTOR IS A WORN PLAQUE READING "CARVER INDUSTRIAL
dialogues.text: EQUIPMENT" with a logo). Ramsey switches on the video monitor and the screen fills with images of Anne dying in the cell. Novak is painfully, tragically drawn to this.  Although h seen his share of horrific things, Novak is truly disturb by the sight of Anne, desperate to escape, drowning, slow dying, and he knows: This is what will happen to Julia Hickson unless he finds her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK.  WATER SPRAYS FROM THE SHOWER.  Caught by surprise Julia blocks the spray with her hands and searches for a off valve.  Of course, there is none.  Thirty seconds lat the water stops.  Like an animal caught in a trap, Julia' eyes dart around her "cage."  What kind of hell is this?  Shivering, she catches herself in the mirror and looks de into it.  Something's odd about the glass.  Is someone watching her?  She bangs on it with her fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: LET ME OUT
dialogues.text: But there's no response.  Only her reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUMAN EYE.  No movement, no deviation of the iris.  A f stare.  The catatonic Stargher lies in a hospital bed, wr cuffed to the frame.  An IV feeds him fluids and monitors report his vital signs.  As a nervous NURSE exits, we see POLICEMEN standing guard in the outer hallway.  Novak, Ra and Teddy Lee stand by as the killer is examined by DR. MILTON REID, a brilliant forensic M.D. currently shining opthalmoscope into Stargher's eyes.  He pulls away and ch the ELECTROENCENPHELOGRAM already on a lightbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minimal activity in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex.  And here, the anterior cingulate cortex. (to Novak and Ramsey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what helps distinguish between external and internal stimuli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering for Reid)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's schizophrenic. Novak doesn't like this.  Not one bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing here, Reid?  Paving the way for his insanity defense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need.  There won't be a trial.  This is no act.  The coma is real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa.  Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever hear of Whalen's Infraction? Clearly not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the EEG)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In any schizophrenic, these areas would be affected.  But in someone with Whalen's, they're hit hard and hit fast. Novak's worry intensifies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stargher's neurological system was infected by a virus in utero.  It lay dormant.  In his case for about... (guesses at Stargher's age)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...thirty years.  Most likely, he's exhibited symptoms for awhile now, but the infraction - the breach - didn't occur 'til today.  You never know when it'll happen, at what age, or why.  The triggers vary, but the results don't. (fascinated by Stargher)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has no ties to reality.  No awareness of this world or the people in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Thorazine? Or... Desoxyn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The normal psychotropics don't work.  He's not just catatonic, he's... disappeared.  Like having a dream and never waking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This girl.  Julia Hickson.  Only he knows where she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'm sorry.  For her and for you. Novak is past angry.  He's bordering on devastation.  Ram attempts to placate him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll go back to his house, Pete.  There's still a lot to do.  Analyze the videos, track sales of the bleach, go through his records.  Maybe he owns property somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in that fucking thing for forty hours, Gordon.  Four-oh.  He got Julia at seven-thirty last night.  You know what time it is now...?! Ramsey backs off, knowing his partner is on the verge of really losing it.  Reid thinks perhaps he shouldn't, but sensitive to Novak's pain and anger, mentions it anyway - only to keep his friend from true hopelessness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter?  This is a longshot.  I mean a real long shot.  You're gonna think I'm crazy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship's engine ROARS TO LIFE and the PROPELLER spins through sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fixed! AT THE TREE TRUNK, Catherine extends her hand and suddenl Edward is there, quite close, reaching out.  Catherine's trembles.  The boy is startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised, to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not signalling... Her hand tenses and shakes uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sing a song of sixpence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry, to the heavens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not signalling! Edward is frightened by what's happening and runs away.  Catherine tries to call out, but her throat constricts, making speech difficult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not...    INT. CAMPBELL CENTER - LABORATORY - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine's face is covered by a cloth floating down from sky.  The sky is replaced by the ceiling and overhead lig of the LABORATORY, but Miriam's face remains constant.  N conscious, Catherine finds herself in the lab at the Camp Center, the suspension device lowering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sing a song of sixpence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pocketful of fucking rye. (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cagey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did we stop? Cooperman appears in the window and explains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked them to. (with gravity)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMALL TV SCREEN shows footage of Anne drowning in the c Catherine, Cooperman, Henry, and Miriam watch with curios disgust, pity.  Novak and Ramsey flank the portable monitor/VCR, knowing this is a disturbing but powerful to There's someone else in the room.  John Tracy.  He cannot watch the video, not again.  Catherine glances at him, uncomfortable with his presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did he lapse into the coma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometime yesterday morning. John tries to keep his composure, but Novak's making this tough for him.  Novak wants the scientists to see, to understand the boy's pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each tape is the same.  He provides food, drinking water, a toilet.  Periodically, a shower starts.  It's on some kind of timer - he's clever with machines, building things.  I think he wants them to believe this is a simple kidnapping.  That there's a possibility of rescue.  Of survival.  But it's just a form of torture.  At the end of the fortieth hour, the drain shuts.  The water starts and doesn't stop. (gravely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've already lost more than a day.  If she isn't found tonight.  She dies like the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Miriam, Henry and Catherine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Ella Baines - as well as the Sunerset Board of Directors - have given their approval, but the decision is yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the legalities of this...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stargher is in custody.  The functional equivalent of being under arrest.  Normally, we'd Mirandize him, and if he didn't lawyer up, we'd interrogate him.  But because of his condition, he doesn't have the capacity to waive those rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what you're asking us to do is illegal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not at all. (explains)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're dealing with exigent circumstances.  Somewhere there's a kidnapped woman still alive.  If we weigh the suspect's Constitutional Rights against the public safety.  The Law favors the victim and gives us a lot of leeway.  It's called the Public Safety Exception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what can you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much anything we want.  There's a chance to save a human life.  Because of that, Stargher has no reasonable expectation of privacy. Miriam, Henry and Cooperman appear to be onboard.  Novak' made a persuasive, heartfelt argument.  Only one person s remains uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if...? All eyes turn to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he wasn't like this?  What if he was "normal?"  Conscious.  How far would you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as I needed. Catherine nods, analyzes Novak's eyes, gestures, body language, and "interrogates" him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he'd tell you what you need to know? John's discomfort is increasing and Novak is sensitive to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's always a chance they'll confess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  I don't work with violent cases, I work with children.  But even a kid lies.  They love it when they get you to believe something that isn't true.  Don't you think Stargher would do the same?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes... Once they've been caught they feel a need for disclosure.  They have so much they want to tell.  But they've never had a sympathetic ear.  They need someone to understand why. (focusing on Catherine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stargher used to hide the bodies very carefully.  It was part of the ritual.  Some weren't found for weeks and any physical evidence had been meticulously wiped clean.  But these last three... They were still in water - always in water - but (clarifies)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, he wasn't just careless.  It went beyond that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Let's assume he wanted you to find him, that some part of him hated what he was doing... Most likely, that part is dead.  Schizophrenics with Whalen's Infraction sever all ties with the real world.  I'm sorry, I really am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he came to trust me, yes, but it takes months to build that kind of trust.  Someone like Stargher can't distinguish between fantasy and reality.  It's all the same.  He might tell me she's in Timbuktu and absolutely, one hundred percent believe it to be true, but she's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia. They turn to John Tracy.  His vulnerable, barely audible voice forcing everyone to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not "she."  Julia.  Not thing, or it, or her.  Do you know anything about her?  Do you know what we've been through?  Julia is everything to me.  Can you say that about anyone?   Catherine hangs her head.  And finds herself looking at photograph of the girl in question.  A smiling Julia Hick looking right at her. WHOOP-WHOOP-WHOOP-WHOOP.  POUNDING REVERBERATIONS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOP-WHOOP-WHOOP-WHOOP.  A HELICOPTER descends onto the A stretcher is removed from the side door of the helicopt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAFF watches with a mixture of fear and curiosity as stretcher bearing the catatonic Stargher is wheeled FAST through the corridors by an FBI escort team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of photographs, drawings, diagrams, maps, blueprints, and documents - Novak's case material - cover every inch of wallspace.  The table is littered with reference books, atlases, telephones, a fax machine, shor wave radio, and computer/Internet terminal.  An FBI TECHNICIAN completes the electronics work and points out "speed dial" functions to Novak and Ramsey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (listing them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quantico.  San Diego Field Office.  S.D., L.A., and San Francisco P.D.  California, Arizona, Nevada State Police.  Nine and ten are open lines. (re: radio set up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Direct link to the chopper. (re: the computer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That gets you into the Bureau Database.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Once he's gone, Ramsey takes this moment "alone" to quest his partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you want to go through with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else do we do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Pete, but for god's sake... This is nuts.  Do you really understand what they're going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why jeopardize what we've already done?  We caught the sonofabitch.  Carl Stargher.  That's going to be like Bundy, Gacy, Dahmer.  A case that makes careers.  But if we push our luck.  If this is all bullshit and we come out smelling like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what.  If this thing burns us, I take that heat.  I give you permission to point your finger at me and say "It was all his idea."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offended)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I'm talking about, Pete.  I'm talking about waking up and realizing this girl's gonna die. The words are anathema to Novak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That won't happen. Cooperman appears in the doorway and informs them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're ready. Ramsey looks to his partner, but Novak is already on Cooperman's heels.  Resignedly, Ramsey follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooperman guides Novak and Ramsey into the lab.  The FBI are impressed, but neither is quite sure what to make it The FBI escort team leader gets Ramsey's signature and No undoes the cuffs from Stargher's wrists and ankles.  Following Miriam's direction, the escorts guide the gurne carrying Stargher into the procedure room.  As Cooperman shows them out, Henry seals shut the door.  Miriam assume responsibility for Stargher's care and checks his pulse, pupil dilation, and vital signs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we get a catheter in him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took care of that, thank you, Henry. (getting him out of her hair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you give our guests a little tour? Proud of his computer, but uncomfortable around strangers Henry directs Novak and Ramsey to the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, you stand before the one and only Neurological Cartography and Synaptic Transfer System. Although he's listening, Novak's eyes never really stray his prisoner as Miriam uses safety scissors to cut away Stargher's clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It provides a highly detailed map of the human mind.  Not the brain - any MRI can do that.  The mind. (self-impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It reads and processes electronically allowing information to be transferred and interrupted. (for the laymen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's say your thoughts could be stored on DVD.  If someone had the right kind of player, they could watch and listen to what you're thinking. Novak observes Miriam as she "undresses" Stargher and Ram pokes around the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we can't record or store the data.  The connections between nerve cells are constantly being modified. Miriam needs a moment to fully take in the scars.  Henry continues, eager to focus attention back to him, but even is fascinated by Stargher's skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like the early days of television.  The subject sends out a live feed and you receive it during time of broadcast.  Whatever happens, happens.  All you have to do is "tune in." Miriam gives Stargher an alcohol bath, the clinical proce taking on the quality of ritual.  Her wash cloth moves un Stargher's chin and over his face.  She's careful around eyes and finds herself unable to look at them for long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you do more than tune in... You become part of the snow. Catherine enters from a dressing area wearing the bodysui Filled with curiosity, Novak watches Miriam and Catherine Stargher into his suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't understand why I can't do this... This isn't some "troubled kid" you're dealing with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How hard could it be...? Catherine and Miriam try to hide their laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first... What?  Six or seven times I went in.   Remember what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disorientation, nausea, migraines, hallucinations, insomnia, paranoia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a New Year's Day hangover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs to be turned over. Novak and Catherine roll Stargher onto his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man is deeply disturbed, he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know the procedure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That may be true, but you don't have Catherine's gift.  She... (distracted by Stargher's back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened here? We see a series of EIGHT BANDAGES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We removed eight metal rings. Miriam peels away a bandage and examines the flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he should like this. Catherine connects Stargher to the SUSPENSION APPARATUS a it HOISTS him off the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're comforted by the feeling of weightlessness.  Like floating in water. Henry catches Ramsey poking his nose near a THIRD SUIT AN APPARATUS in the dressing area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch that, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Miriam prepares a series of CHEMICAL CARTRIDGES and loads them into a container connected to the IV-like tubes link to the suspension device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intimate, quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't your responsibility.  Remember that.  Don't let them use guilt as a tool.  If you want to stop, say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said convincingly. Catherine focuses on the procedure and makes the necessar connections.  Reluctantly, Miriam retreats to the monitor station.  She "locks down" the procedure room and joins Henry, Novak, and Ramsey at the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes on the chemical/drug monitors)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About twelve years of research, right Miriam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't remind me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it - are they - exactly? That's like asking her to explain the rules of cricket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psychostimulants, serotonin, stabilizers, meprobamate, Neurontin, lithium carbonate.  And my baby.  It duplicates and expands upon the effects of a chemical called oxytocin, forcing a break in the neuron connections that hold experience.  So new experience can form. Ramsey is utterly lost and just sort of nods, but Novak i fascinated.  Catherine presses the bump on her hand.  A R INDICATOR LIGHT flashes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a touch-sensitive microchip implanted in her hand.  If she becomes frightened, disoriented, or simply wants to end the session, she signals us to abort. Catherine presses again and the red light shuts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although none of what she experiences is real, she can be tricked into thinking it is.  The mind is awfully gullible, so she needs to monitor herself. Catherine and Stargher are suspended from the ceiling.  H types and the lights dim to a more somber, tranquil level Various screens flicker to life, displaying the vital sig of both "feed" and receive."  Miriam initiates the inject program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine?  I'm about to start.  If you want me to wait, or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No. IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, we see chemicals mix with her bloo then feed the IV.  AT THE CONSOLE, as Henry types furious at the computer keyboard, Novak asks Miriam:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said she has a "gift." Overhearing, Henry interrupts, pointing at a section of Catherine's "mind map."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a gift.  A highly evolved area in her cerebral cortex, that's all.  A genetic fluke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine has a tremendous capacity for empathy. (clarifies)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we started, there were a number of test subjects - other therapists - who acted as "receivers."  All they did was observe and report.  Nothing more.  But Catherine, she had the ability to feel what was happening.  She understood.  And the patient responded.  Edward engaged her in dialogue, took her places, showed her things.  He knew she cared. A hopeful, solemn Novak gazes through the window, watchin Catherine's body as it becomes parallel to Stargher's... IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, Catherine takes a deep breath and the drugs take effect, feels herself losing consciousness She glances at Stargher, a man who tortures and kills wom then looks up as the CLOTH MASK descends from the ceiling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intravenous administration complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Initiating connection. We follow fibrous wires running from Catherine's mask to Stargher's.  Their blood mixing with chemicals in the IV- containers.  The computer system humming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transfer begins 1100 hours, 34 minutes, 12 seconds. Catherine's eye focuses on the mask.  As it comes closer, see the lining is laced with thread-like wires and microc forming hyper-miniature circuit boards.  Catherine's eye blinks.  The mask covers her face.  Catherine's eye shuts Vision fades.  Darkness.  A faint light.  Microscopic vei in the eyelid become wires connected to chips.  And we're MOVING, into the circuitry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pattern of the electronics grows into something more organic, textured, concrete.  Evolving into a world.  Bla and shadow-filled, it resembles a labyrinthine complex of vertical walls with cubicle like rooms carved deep into i core. Our journey into this bleak, grim place continues and we occasionally glimpse brief images of a boy's baptism. INTERCUT with this journey are sections of cloudy blackne and fragmented visions of CATHERINE connected to the apparatus, face masked, DESCENDING into this world. There is an abrupt SHIFT from still images to regular mot and we find ourselves gliding over a tidepool filled with tiny fish and tadpoles.  At water's edge, lying on rough, pebble-strewn ground, is a HAND. Catherine's hand.  We sense MOVEMENT, but she remains sti From the darkness comes a DOG.  Black in color and featureless, it sniffs Catherine, dismisses her, and mean into a cubicle opposite her, disappearing from view.  Aft moment of odd quiet, a DROP OF BLOOD hits the mask and we follow Catherine's hand as it moves to the cloth and remo it from her own face. IN MACROSCOPIC SUPER SLOW-MOTIONS, another BLOOD DROPLET sails 64 into the air and comes crashing down, hitting a ANT, catapulting it onto what looks like a tree, but is j a TWIG.  As the insect scurries away, MORE DROPS pound th earth, splatter against "twig trees," and explode into po of stagnant water... As we begin to realize that this miniature landscape is t world into which Catherine descended. She sits up, shivering, and breathes deeply, acclimating her surroundings.  The "floor" is covered with filth, ash pebbles, and insects.  Water is present in many forms, puddles, moisture, dripping ceilings. Eyes focusing, queasy, not fully "awake," Catherine notic the crimson stain on the cloth mask and the blood droplet showering the air.  She turns and finds the source. THE BLACK DOG stands in the opposite room next to a tub f of BLOOD, shaking himself dry after his "bath."  Satisfie the animal stops and trots away.  Still adjusting to this nightmarish realm, Catherine at first doesn't hear it, bu then realizes that somewhere, a child is CRYING.  She loo around, then through a crack in the "floor," briefly catc sight of a BOY beneath her, on a level lower than hers. he disappears into corridor ending in "nothing," we PULL to show a MASSIVE LANDSCAPE of blocks, cubicles, crawlspa walls, stairs, and ladders.  Leading everywhere and nowhe Catherine spots the boy as he crawls into a specific "roo Shortly after, a LIGHT comes on within the cubicle and sh moves to it.  We feel as though we're looking at a series interlocked tenement rooms, some walls of which have been torn away to expose rooms within, rooms with no windows o doors.  Following a path of fragile steps, Catherine make her way to the LIGHTED ROOM and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mottled HORSE stands with its head down, nose kissing t floor, allowing the BOY to caress its neck.  This sweet animal is an incrongruous vision in this hellish world an Catherine approaches with respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? The frightened child retreats into a corner of the claustrophobic room, but the horse does not startle.  Surprisingly - to the boy - the horse takes an affectiona step toward Catherine, inviting her to take over.  Cather allows the mare to smell her, then vigorously scratches a the mane and shoulder, much to the horse's delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you like that, don't you? She can see the boy hiding in the corner, stealing glance her from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your name Carl? The boy - YOUNG STARGHER - is startled and intrigued by t question - How did she know that?! - but says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another little boy I know, he has a horse, too. The boy reacts to an unusual SOUND coming from the CEILIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name's Edward.  The boy, not the horse... The boy takes a few steps toward her, out of the shadows, he seems more concerned about something in the ceiling th "connecting" with Catherine.  Very anxiously, he looks at wall behind Catherine and watches an old wind-up kitchen TIMER click down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Carl? Again, a sharp SOUND from the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wro---? Young Stargher RUNS at her and SHOVES her hard!  Catherin FALLS BACK just as EIGHT SHEETS OF GLASS drop from the ceiling!  Like oversize razor blades, they slice the hors into four clean sections.  They separate and compact the quadrants until four glass-contained sections of dissecte horse stand within the room.  Catherine SCREAMS, but the barely acknowledged what happened.  Betraying no emotion, boy runs.  The shaken Catherine takes a moment to collect herself, then gives chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Stargher knows his way around the landscape, but Catherine has difficulty simply keeping him in sight.  Sh runs, climbs and crawls.  Until she's utterly lost and disoriented.  Tired and having difficulty breathing, she drops to her knees and "cools down."  She hears a NOISE nearby, gets to her feet, and finds a GEARED MECHANISM connected to some kind of SHUTTERED DOOR composed of an almost metallic-looking glass.  Curious yet cautious, she examines the nearby walls, floor, and ceiling for any sig of "traps" akin to the glass blades.  Finding none, she p the mechanism and quickly steps back. The shutter opens and Catherine knows there's something a in the tiny cubicle beyond.  She retreats into shadow, hiding.  Released from the chamber is a WOMAN.  As she mo out of a darkness, we see VICTIM ONE. Ghostly pale and adorned in eerie fetish garb, she appear "sense" the presence of a stranger, targets Catherine in shadows, and ATTACKS! Catherine's had enough and moves to press the implant, BU

dialogues.speaker: THE VICTIM IS ALREADY THERE
dialogues.text: She brutally grabs Catherine, THROWS her against the wall SMACKS her head against it.  Catherine drops to the floor like a rag doll. Victim One hefts Catherine onto her shoulder and with gre purpose, carries her deep into the labyrinth, toward the core.  Passing in and out of consciousness, between darkn and light, a dazed Catherine is taken on a "tour" of Stargher's world.  Passing mausoleum-like chambers filled with IMAGES of unspeakable horror and/or disturbing intensity.  At one of the rooms, we think we see Young Stargher silently observing... Sitting of standing in individual cubicles are STARGHER'S OTHER VICTIMS (TWO thru SIX), each woman resembling the grotesque porcelain dolls glimpsed in the cubbyholes in Stargher's basement.  Dressed by a fetishistic sadist (Ni Inch Nails meets the Brides of Dracula), they resemble bo housewives, barely acknowledging the new member of the "harem."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICTIM ONE drops Catherine in the center of the room and, done, crawls away. Groggy, feeling sick, Catherine sits up.  Unbeknownst to she is sitting at the base of a pedestal with her back to kind of THRONE.  And someone is there.  In the dim pool o light above the pedestal, we see a MAN rise from the thro The wall behind him is covered in BLOOD RED CLOTH, and as descends, we realize it is a CAPE connected to EIGHT META RINGS pierced through the flesh of his back.  In a fluid motion, waves of red give way to harshly textured concret the man reaches the floor.  Catherine knows he is there.  Unable to stop herself, she turns.  And sees the terrifyi face of STARGHER.  But no the same Stargher. This is STARGHER KING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (primitive, guttural)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you come from priddy thing? In a split second, Catherine presses the implant on her h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently capable of staying awake if properly caffeinat Novak sits cross-legged on the floor, shoes off, analyzin RECENT PHOTOS AND DOCUMENTS sent to him via courier.
