Ignoring a snoring Ramsey napping on a nearby cot, Novak looks at blow-ups from the videos, blueprints of Stargher house, detailed shots of the basement, and a draftsman's conceptual drawing of the cell itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen? Novak looks at an INTERCOM SPEAKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's back. Novak doesn't wait for his just-stirring partner and move

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he enters, Novak sees a concerned Henry checking a pri out of the procedure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must've been rather unusual. Noting Novak's confusion, Henry points to a CENTRAL MONIT resembling a futuristic V.U. meter, gradiated in sections white, yellow, orange, and red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: white/yellow area)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If her neural activity stays within this range, I know she's self-cognitive. (clarifies)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if she were having a dream, but she knows she's dreaming.  She can "wake up" any time she wants to... As Ramsey joins them, Novak nods, understanding, but his are on Catherine, who's just coming back to consciousness

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: orange section)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However, if her level of involvement is rather intense, as it was just now, she can perceive things as true.  It's difficult to keep perspective. As Novak lingers on that question, Ramsey gestures at the section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't talk about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Theoretically, while she's inside.  If she came to believe that Stargher's world is her world, her mind has the power to convince the body that anything done to it is, um, actually done. Novak doesn't like the sound of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why we monitor the use of the drugs so closely.  We don't want her getting to that degree of perceptual disorientation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pump in two liters of pure oxygen, please Henry. Henry types a command and Novak speaks into the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Kent? IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, Miriam eases Catherine back to consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep breaths. When she sees Stargher, Catherine's flesh crawls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it cold in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? Incapable of being in the same room as him, Catherine tea out of the apparatus and anxiously exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A worried Novak searches the halls of the Campbell Center He's about to ask the staff for help, but stops when he s through the window to Edward's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine sits next to the boy's bed, holding Edward's ha softly singing a lullaby (to him, to herself).  Feeling t he must speak to her, Novak intervenes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward Baines, I presume. (to the catatonic child)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Ed.  I'm Pete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think that's funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not at all.  From what I understand, he knows I"m here, isn't that right? Catherine nods.  Novak picks up Edward's fallen teddy bea and rests it in the crook of the child's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read about a woman in TExas who was in a coma for seven years.  Every time her husband came to visit, her heart would beat faster.  Isn't that something?  I don't know what name scientists have for something like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't have much to do with science.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soul.  The spirit.  Whatever you want to call it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, the part of us that can't be explained. She appreciates his understanding.  And finds herself comforted by his presence.  Catherine scrutinizes Novak, intensity, his honesty, his complexity.  And asks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Novak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel there's a side of yourself you don't show people? The question catches Novak off-guard, but he's willing to answer.  Anything to get her talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. (realizing it's too personal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose everyone does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like we all have fantasies, right?  Things only we know, that we don't share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what therapists are for, right? Catherine laughs.  It helps her relax.  If only slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the sessions.  When I'm inside.  I see those things.  What a person hides, what they despite, what they want to control.  With Stargher... This is difficult for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Stargher I saw things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (professionally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A kingdom.  His utopia.  Life without consequence or restriction.  He's not even Carl Stargher anymore.  He's this... idealized version of himself who can do anything he pleases... Without fear.  A horrible primitive ugly thing. (uncomfortable; re: Edward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk in here. She kisses Edward's forehead and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine and Novak sit on a bench in the center of the courtyard.  John Tracy is visible in the reception area, unable to sleep, desperately trying to fight frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you bring him here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the shrink, you tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (already knows)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as I met him, you knew I'd say yes.  He makes Julia real for me. Novak nods.  Guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an old lawyer trick.  Target the emotions.  Do it right, you get a reluctant witness to testify, a scared kid to confess. Catherine looks at him with disbelief.  "You?!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I was with the Bureau, I was an attorney, a prosecutor.  Mr. Law and Order.  And then... I had a murder case in North Carolina.  Charles Gish.  Butchered seventeen people in three days.  And because of one tiny piece of tainted evidence, he walked. (no regrets)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when I quit the DA's office and joined the FBI. Catherine can see the pain and frustration in Novak's eye She gives him a moment and asks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought Stargher wanted to be caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right.  There's a part of him that knows the truth.  About what he did, about himself. Novak's curiosity is piqued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Julia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to sound terrible, but... I don't think she matters anymore.  Not to him.  He never finished her.  The others...he was able to make them his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can do this, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might tell me about Julia.  The part of him that wants to help, that feels shame and remorse.  Who wants to be redeemed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Stargher we're talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Stargher, not really.  He's split himself right down the middle.  Good/evil, right/wrong, merciful/cruel.  A monster.  And an innocent child.  If I could reach the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa.  Hold on.  Aren't they the same guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you feel there are different sides to every personality?  Maybe even the worst of us is capable of one decent act.  We're all human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard for me to see Stargher as human, capable of something like "remorse."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this is a big fucking waste of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensing something)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Charles Gish? Novak doesn't respond.  She prods him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What difference does it make...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me. God, he does not want to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right after the trial, the night after he was released.  Mr. and Mrs. Frank Simmons found Charlie sitting in their living room watching TV with their twelve-year old daughter Margaret.  He'd cut her right down the middle with a carving knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found the girl's heart in the freezer - he thought they might want to keep it. (grim humor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luckily, the next thing he did was slit his own throat. (bleakly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am convinced of one thing.  Charles Gish could've been raised by Ozzie and Harriet and the same thing would've happened. He can see Catherine doesn't accept that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A child can experience abuse worse than Charlie's.  And grow up to be someone who would never, ever hurt another living thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I am. Catherine realizes that was a confession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell you been? They turn to see Ramsey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time, tell me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you looked so cute.  All sleepy... Ramsey shoots him a murderous look, then asks Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your colleagues want to know what to do with Stargher. Novak looks to Catherine for the answer.  Through the win blinds, she watches John Tracy lower his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them to prep him.  And that I'll be right there. Ramsey nods and heads back to the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Briefly, he touches her hand.  Catherine looks away from to Novak's hand, to the photographs on the wall.  Starghe house, Valentine, the pick-up truck.  Valentine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A K-9 UNIT FBI AGENT escorts VALENTINE to the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the agent brings the frightened animal into the monito area, Catherine and Valentine share a moment of "connecti Slowly, confidently, she approaches the Shepherd, kneels, removes his leash and muzzle.  She strokes him and the do instantly warms up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure wasn't like that with me. Novak signs a document and the K-9 Agent exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good boy, aren't you, Valentine? The dog picks up a scent from the procedure room and move it, Catherine and Novak following. IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, Stargher lies face down on a gurne Now taped to the wall near Stargher are PICTURES from the basement - his dolls, the hoist, etc.  Miriam (in surgica mask and gloves) carefully re-inserts the METAL RINGS (ta from an FBI EVIDENCE BAG) into the eight straps of flesh his back.  When he sees this, Valentine whimpers and hide Catherine comforts him.  Miriam finishes her task and rem her mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to admit it, but there's something perversely satisfying about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's the whole point. Valentine runs to his "sleeping" master and barks at Catherine as if asking for help.  She encourages the anim to lick and sniff Stargher's face and hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's interesting. IN THE CONTROL ROOM, he scrutinizes the monitor showing t detailed "map" of Stargher's brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Increased neural activity in the frontal lobes.  Rising dopamine levels in the basal ganglia.  Ever since the dog walked in. IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, Catherine readies herself in the "receive" apparatus.  As Stargher is lifted off the pedes the doors HISS shut and Valentine curls up on the floor beneath his master.  As Catherine is lifted, she smiles a the animal, then looks to Stargher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (comforting and coaching her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, Julia Hickson is priority number one.  Nothing else matters.  Find out where she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... LIGHTS FLICKER.  Catherine's eyes shut.  FADE TO BLACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh... LIGHTS FLICKER.  We hear an ELECTRICAL HUM rise and fall. Catherine opens her eyes and the LIGHTS blink on and off weird pattern, making it difficult to see clearly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't kid around, Henry... Her suspension apparatus DESCENDS on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.  It's a power problem.  I need you to go to the circuit breaker and check switches six through twelve. Catherine moves toward the electrical panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to stay awake, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah.  I'm not sleepy. As she moves toward the panel, everything becomes larger. the time Catherine reaches the circuit breaker, it is the size of a garage door.  Curiouser and curiouser... She turns around to see the LABORATORY IS EMPTY and DEAD QUIET.  And she sees herself - Catherine as small as a mo trapped in a giant walled space. AT THE CONSOLE, Novak, Miriam and Henry observe the proce room.  And Catherine.  Suspended in the apparatus.  Motionless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine turns to see... Catherine lying in the fetal position, locked in a BOX made of thick clean glass.  The electronic HUM becomes RHYTHMIC, AMBIENT NOISE.. INSIDE T BOX, staying calm, she searches for and finds a TRAP DOOR the floor.  She pushes out.  The camera executes a comple 180-degree perspective change. Catherine plummets.  She tries to reach out, to stop her descent, but cannot. Catherine falls through a dark CAVERNOUS ROOM resembling mammoth hollowed-out rib cage.  Below her is a DOME-LIKE STRUCTURE "growing" out of the floor, a HOLE in the cente its crest.  Dozens of other such domes are visible in the murky hell-hole, but Catherine has no choice.  She's drop into this one. Once she passes through the hole, INSIDE THE DOME, Catherine's body looks as though it's moving through wate but there is no water.  Like an aerial artist, she revers her position so she's "heads up."  Standing, stable, on t floor.  Sensing something with her.  And knows it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine? Out from the darkness, moving in normal motion, comes the white German Shepherd, but in the thick haze, his face is indistinct and ghostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi sweetie... And as she steps toward him, his face DISSOLVES into a ST LANDSCAPE.  An ear becomes a hill, the nose a stone, mout path, and the eye a HOUSE.  YOUNG STARGHER retreats towards the bleak structure as CATHERINE ENTERS FRAME.  Seeing the invitation, she press on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Stargher is at the sink WASHING DISHES, an anxious on the clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need some help? As Catherine enters the claustrophobic house, the boy hesitantly pushes a towel toward her, but doesn't look. reaches the counter and starts to dry, much to Young Stargher's relief.  As he washes, Catherine hands him a MIRROR LOCKET just like Edward's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, I want to give you a present. He's hypnotized by the thing, his eyes lighting up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need me, or if you feel that I'm around but can't find me, just shine it, like this. She shines reflected light onto the walls.  Carl hands Catherine the wet plate and takes the locket.  The dish s from her fingers and SHATTERS on the floor.  The boy's ey fill with dread.  The kitchen clock reads 5:30.  He PUSHE Catherine toward a broom closet and shoves her inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong honey? With a finger to his lips, he pockets the locket and shut the door.  FROM WITHIN THE CLOSET, she watches the terrif child through a CRACK in the door.  IN THE KITCHEN, Young Stargher desperately tries to hide the broken plate.  Startlingly, his father, Martin Stargher, is already in t room.  Cruel, imposing, manipulative man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do know?  You make a mess?  I hate a mess. Young Stargher backs into a corner, fearing what will com

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie, now, Carl. IN THE CLOSET, Catherine pushes, but the door won't budge She POUNDS.  IN THE KITCHEN, we hear no sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember what I said about liars?  Liars will be punished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine hears the child SCREAM.  But the scream comes f behind and she spins around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Stargher is forced to sit on the lap of an ugly MID AGED WOMAN barely wearing a man's robe.  On a nearby tabl are whisky, tumblers, and an ashtray filled with butts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you a present, cutie-pie. She gives him a TOY DOLL.  Drunk, she hugs and kisses him Embarrassed, the boy tries to squirm away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.  You're not going anywhere. Martin enters and sneers at the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to bed, worm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, we was just.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, cunt. The woman cowers, familiar with his violent moods.  The b hurries to his room, but Martin grabs him by the collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that? He pulls the doll from the child's hands, turns to the wo and SMACKS her across the face with it, gashing her cheek

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You give him nothing.  Whore.  Are you his mother?  ARE YOU? Terrified, she shakes her head "no."  Martin sees Young Stargher quietly crawling away, hoping to escape.  Martin lifts the boy off the floor with one hand and hold him in front of the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that?  SEE IT?  You slithered out one of them.  But where is she now, Carl?  As far from you as she could get, that's where. (shoves him at the woman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a mommy?  Is that what you want? The poor boy trembles with fear.  And Martin notices a pu of urine on the floor.  He drops the boy and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little worm pissed his pants. Humiliated, Carl covers himself and hides in a corner.  Martin and the woman LAUGH AND LAUGH, delighting in the b humiliation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling the boy's shame, Catherine turns and finds a FADE POSTCARD taped to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin has discovered his son's secret hiding place - a camouflaged corner of the attic.  Arranged in deliberate, artistic fashion are scavenged DOLLS.  Heads, limbs and torsos held together with twine, tape and wire.  Some wra in filthy plastic.  Faded photographs (including one of h MOTHER), mementos, and most disturbingly, the feathers an bones of dead birds, insect carcasses, and dissected, desiccated mice.  There's something peculiarly beautiful here, but Martin doesn't see it.  Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only girls play with dolls... He turns and we see Carl is bound to a wooden support bea piece of tape covering his mouth.  The boy is stripped to waste, barely conscious, face streaked with tears and swe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of thing are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WEIRD NOISE snaps Catherine back to "reality."  She tur just as a door opens behind her.  Responding to the "invitation," she moves through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The adult Carl Stargher sits at the edge of the tub, his to us, smoking a cigarette.  A white German Shepherd PUPP clicks across the tile floor and YIPS at Catherine.  She again hears the WEIRD NOISE.  A STAINLESS STEEL BOWL wobb as Stargher's bloody rubber-gloved hands fill it with something.  Stargher knows she's there and isn't surprise her presence, but he's not sure what to make of her.  Wha do with her.  He rises and walks past her to the sink.  H pulls off the gloves and washes his hands, glancing at he the mirror. Catherine cannot resist looking in the tub.  She sees a d girl, her torso sliced open.  Disgusted and mortified, sh pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was the first... She turns, and Stargher is no longer at the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't know what I was doing... She turns, where's this voice coming from?!  She steps ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful... The bumps into the stainless steel bowl and it topples to floor, spilling its contents of human organs.  Wobble-wob wobble.  The bowl makes its now-familiar noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do now?  You make a mess? And she can see him coming out of the shadows.  Catherine backs into a corner, fearing what will come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate a mess. Stargher steps into a pool of light, shooshes the puppy i the hall, shuts the bathroom door, and looks right at Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here? God almighty, what does she say?  What does she tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie, now... SCRITCH-SCRITCH-SCRITCH.  The puppy scratches at the door whimpers, but Stargher's not about to let him back in.  Moving slowly, carefully, he approaches Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liars will be punished.   Catherine makes a break for the door.  "Playfully," Starg makes a half-hearted attempt to block her, but she evades and reaches for the knob.  But the door's not there.  SCR SCRITCH-SCRITCH.  She can still hear the dog, but there's damn door.  She turns: No door.  No window.  The girl's body and bloody remains vanished.  An OVERHEAD LIGHT flickers on, giving the room look and feel of the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think you're going? Catherine turns, back to the wall, calm and intimidating, Stargher stands in the center regarding her with great curiosity.  Catherine's ready to press the sensor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that. She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you go away, you'll never find her. How did he know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you never find her, she dies.  Like the rest. Catherine stops and listens.  She can't leave now.  The p to Julia has appeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, that's why you're here, right?  Why you came to my happy little home? He reaches for her and she flinches.  Expecting such behavior, Stargher grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pretty.  A pretty, pretty thing. Catherine cannot show her fear, not now.  She composes herself and approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to help you, Carl. His grin broadens to a smile and he almost laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me?  That's good.  That's a good one. (malevolent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar.  Whore.  Cunt. Catherine stands her ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound like your father. He gets close to her face and sneers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not like him. Stargher retreats into the shadows, but Catherine persist

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then help me.  Where is Julia Hickson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe, because you want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?  You think you know me?   INT. CAMPBELL CENTER - LABORATORY - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry sees a rapid rise in Catherine's warning meter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miriam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wave of fear, of impending doom, overtakes Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna know who I am?  You stupid bitch! And when he emerges from shadow, Stargher is STARGHER KIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now shud you mouth, priddy thing, or me god slice you from the kunt to the tits. Catherine moves to touch the sensor in her hand.  He GRAB LIFTS and SLAMS her onto the floor, the back of her head HITTING HARD.  Her vision blurs.  Ears are ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me god want you stay. Stargher King straddles Catherine and pins her arms behin her back.  She's unable to touch the sensor.  With the ti the TOOL he traces a line from her pelvis up the center o her suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me god mek you beaudiful... He shoves the tool through her neck and presses the trigg A COLLAR CLAMPS SHUT around Catherine's neck and... She blacks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SENSOR ALARM SOUNDS on the computer.  Henry and Miriam express shock at the sight of the monitor peaking in the and move to the "map" of Catherine's mind.  As it becomes "cool," Stargher's becomes "hot."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch! IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, VALENTINE BARKS!  Startling everyo The dog GROWLS and backs away.  As if he senses something horribly wrong within his master. IN THE CONTROL ROOM, Novak questions the scientists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we got here, you just topped and pulled her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was with Edward.  She's accustomed to his world.  Stargher's mind is unfamiliar territory.  She's "lost." (looks at the third suit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone has to go in.  Remind her what's really happening.  And get her out.  Until then, she's at his mercy. Mercy.  Novak's mind reels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into Stargher.  Inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Novak knows who that person will be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fueling herself with candy and juice, Julia examines the for a way out, but finds tight seals everywhere.  THE SHO ERUPTS WITH WATER!   She counts until thirty, it stops.  Shivering, Julia stars at the drain as the water spirals down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to remember the words)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Father, who art in heaven, hallowed be thy name.  Thy kingdom come, thy will be done. ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE GLASS, we watch her through one- glass from the video camera's point-of-view.  She looks r at "us," in the mirror, saddened by the dark circles unde her bloodshot eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...on Earth as it is in Heaven. We drift to the right and see the l.e.d. counters CLICKIN AWAY.  01:44:54, 01:44:53, 01:44:52... Less than TWO HOUR live and she has no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, Novak lies in a hastily-rigged THI APPARATUS/SUSPENSION DEVICE.  Miriam connects him to the cylinder and tubes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have done this, you know.  Been inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Miriam nods, knowing he won't accept an opposing argument

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (instructs him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep breaths. IN THE OBSERVATION ROOM, Henry adjusts monitors showing Novak's vital signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulse is rapid, pressure's a little high... IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, Miriam asks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. She loads a MICROCHIP SENSOR into a high-pressure injecti gun and IMPLANTS it in NOVAK's HAND.  He winces from the brief pain as she loads the chemical cartridges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to ask you some things... Are you taking any prescription drugs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prevacid.  For my stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any psychiatric medication?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about narcotics?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know your partner's here, but it's very important that you're honest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.  I'm a pretty boring guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt that. Henry checks the "maps,"  Catherine's vitals and reports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should hurry. Miriam walks Novak through what's about to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first five minutes will be disorienting.  Give yourself time.  Let the drugs do the work.  If you can see, smell, feel, hear, taste things - you're on the right track.  Once you've acclimated, try to get a feeling for Catherine.  Instinct plays a huge role in this.  Trust it. She gives him a supportive touch on the shoulder, exits a shuts the door.  IN THE OBSERVATION ROOM, Miriam continue via intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can control how you see yourself - clothes, shoes, that kind of thing - but the rest of it is up to him.  Use only what he provides.  Don't try to change anything.  Or introduce something of your own.  It'll only upset him. IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, Novak flexes his fingers and sees little bump beneath his flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Novak?  Press the sensor. Novak does and the red light comes on.  As Novak is LIFTE he looks at Catherine, then Stargher.  Valentine YIPS and settles beneath Novak.  The suspension device clicks into place and the MASK descends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter what happens, Peter, remember one thing: It's not real. Novak's eyes fix on the clear liquid contained in the IV- cylinder.  A liquid cloud of his blood grows within.  Preparing the mixture for injection. The viscosity of the fluid starts to thicken and the CAME MOVES INTO THE MIXTURE.  As blood and chemical swirls tak shape, we MOVE FAST.  Deeper into the fluid at a molecula level.  We feel like we're SOARING over some kind of liqu landscape. NOVAK HYPERVENTILATES.  He's having difficulty making the transition. Flying faster, faster, faster.  Through an entire univers Novak is in the procedure room.  Alone.  His face contort as if feeling the effects of tremendous G-FORCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOUDS hover above a dark, gloomy landscape dotted with hills.  THREE IDENTICAL WOMEN sit on black earth, their bodies positioned in a uniform pattern.  PULL BACK TO REV NOVAK at their feet, in a kneeling fetal position, face d in the gritty soil, a piece of cloth draped over his head With difficulty, practically inhaling black grit, Novak breathes deeply and rises to his knees.  His hand moves t his face and he's briefly astounded by the texture of the gravel, the sharpness of it against his face.  Removing t shroud-like cloth, he looks at the soil, smells it, taste it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen him? Novak finds the first of the three - VISIONS OF STARGHER' MOTHER - addressing him.  She, like the other two, speaks a ghostly monotone, nearly devoid of emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My boy, my little one.  His father took him from me.  Have you seen him? As she continues, almost mantra-like, WOMAN TWO BEGINS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (similar monotone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My child is an abomination.  He is damned.  He has no soul. The women's repetitive "monologues" overlap.  Aurual laye now added by THREE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me god me boy.  Me god good son. Novak takes a moment to absorb his surroundings.  The sig sounds and feel of the place.  Like being within a dream. he backs away from the odd quartet, SHIMMERING LIGHT danc across his face.  Shading his eyes.  Novak searches for t source. Opposite him, across the valley, is a SHEER ROCK WALL.  A massive cliff face pockmarked with rough "windows."  Like star, the LIGHT sparkles inside one of them, a fragment o MIRROR reflecting a beam away from Novak's face to a PATH cutting across the valley floor to the base of the wall. The light guiding him, Novak follows the path and starts CLIMB, finding stairs or ladders, passing deep, seemingly infinite passages.  Like tombs, or the "drawers" of a mausoleum.  Deep within one of them, THE LIGHT FLICKERS.  Fades.  And Novak crawls into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Novak emerges in a cavernous room dripping with decadence The place reeks of sex, pain, lust, and cruelty.  As he m deeper into the chamber, Novak sees YOUNG STARGHER perche atop some kind of pedestal, crouching, fingering his mirr LOCKET, bouncing sparkles of light into the dark corners the room The FLICKERING LIGHT pinpoints a FIGURE emerging from the darkness.  It is Catherine.  Altered to an image of Stargher's victims.  Her skin, face, clothing, eyes, are like the Victims'.  It's a shocking, strange image, made more disturbing by the look of pleasure on her face.  Nov is staggered by the sight.  His vision and hearing become affected by blurred vision, sharp sounds - then focus to clarity as he reminds himself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not real... Like an ethereal queen of the damned, she strides toward narrowing her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine. She exhibits no recognition of her name.  Catherine seductively moves closer to Novak, their bodies almost touching, her hands caressing his hair, lips, neck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.  Catherine.  Listen to me... She presses her finger to his lips and forces him down, o the floor, his back to the pedestal.  Catherine straddles Novak, and when he tries to stand, she holds him down, forcing him to stay.

dialogues.speaker: LISTEN TO ME
dialogues.text: She steals a glance over his shoulder and glimpses a MALE FIGURE coming toward them, coming into the light.  Novak utterly unaware of what's happening.  Catherine is keepin him occupied.  Waiting for the arrival of...

dialogues.speaker: STARGHER KING
dialogues.text: Catherine LAUGHS.  Novak catches only a fleeting glimpse the monster before Stargher King GRABS him by the throat SMASHES his head against a pedestal. BLACKOUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyelids rise and flutter.  Novak becomes conscious.  And instantly realizes what's happened. He lies on the pedestal, face up, spread-eagle, his wrist and ankles bound to the cold stone surface with leathery cords.  Standing over him, in a pool of light, is Starghe King.  Wearing what could be seen as CEREMONIAL GARB, a silent, solemn Stargher King prepares himself for executi of a ritual by polishing and arranging an assortment of shiny, sharp, macabre TOOLS. Novak shuts his eyes and silently tells himself, Not real He opens them, breathes deeply and focuses on Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Catherine Young.  You majored in Psych at UC San Diego.  You work for Sunerset Industries. Stargher King's fingers pass over an array of horrific instruments - the throat piercer/collar mechanism, a clea knife, a misshapen hammer, a long slender needle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your grandmother raised you after your parents died in a car crash... Stargher King lifts the blade-like NEEDLE.  So far, Cathe looks at Novak like he's speaking gibberish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you were twenty-one, you were arrested for possession and got off with community service. Stargher King SLICES through Novak's clothes, exposing th flesh of his abdomen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reminding himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not real, Pete...This is not real... (urgency)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had to work at a center for abused kids for three months.  You stayed on two years for no pay.  You give half your fucking salary to the nursing home your grandmother stays at... Stargher King grabs his throat and traces the blade down center of Novak's torso.  Novak struggles and pleads with Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this because I work for the FBI.  Peter Novak, remember?!?! (a desperate request)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember.  You are Cath- Stargher King cuts his flesh and INSERTS the needle into stomach.  NOVAK SCREAMS!  This fucking hurts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me!!! Stargher King wiggles the needle, pulls it out, and digs finger into the wound.  NOVAK CRIES IN PAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tears forming, horrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking FEELS real! The intensity of Novak's cries hit Catherine like a thunderbolt.  There's a glimmer of life, of recognition i her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally speaking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me god gut you like a dear. Although we don't see it, we HEAR something awful.  Like Stargher King fishing around inside the wound.  A pale, sweating Novak tries to stay conscious.  He will not go i shock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not real.  Not real.  Not real. A FEMALE HAND grabs the tool from the tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimicking Novak, laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nod reel, nod reel, nod reel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THING THROUGH HIS THROAT!   As Stargher King stumbles awa gagging, blood pouring form his neck, we see that she has returned to normal.  The "bride" persona is gone.  As Stargher King emits animalistic growls, Catherine turns a sees an intact Novak standing next to her.  As if nothing happened. Catherine and Novak RUN out of the den, into the tunnel f which Novak gained access.  He stops, ready to press the sensor, when a FLICKER OF LIGHT dances across Catherine's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like hell "wait." But she won't listen and he's forced to play catch up as moves further from the den toward the cliff face.  The FLICKER OF LIGHT shines on the entrance to a specific TUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants us to follow.  The little boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little boy?!  That's him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brought you to me, didn't he?  If you want Julia to live, trust me.  Trust him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On her hands and knees, she enters the TUNNEL, not waitin for him to respond.  She knows what he'll do... Catherine Novak crawl through the dark, grimy claustrophobic space, playing with his mirror locket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl... He so desperately wants her affection, but fear prevents from reaching out to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Peter. Scared, he shakes his head "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be scared.  You're my friend and I would never hurt you. She extends her hand.  Oh-so-hesitantly he takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you take us to her?  To Julia? Shyly, hesitantly, he nods.  She smiles gratefully and affectionately touches the boy's face.  Clasping her hand Young Stargher leads Catherine and Novak into utter darkn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More stylized than the actual cell, it's bigger and ornat decorated, with the atmosphere of a church.  Individual IMAGES hang like SHRINES, each showing Julia Hickson from different angles. Central to the room is a WINDOW INTO THE CELL ITSELF.  Wh we find a beautiful, mermaid-like JULIA HICKSON floating water.  Peaceful, joyous. IN THE CENTER OF THE ROOM, we find Novak and Catherine, s holding the hand of Young Stargher, he stunned at the sig of Julia.  The child looks at Catherine with beatific, sa eyes, regarding her as one would a saviour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, do you know?  Like on a map... He shakes his head and buries his face in her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, it's okay.  You helped so much already.  I'm proud of you. As a frustrated Novak searches for anything identifying, Catherine comforts the boy and looks deeply into his sad, haunted eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, I think I can help you.  Would you like that?  Even if Peter can't find Julia, I want to help you. The boy leans against her and she caresses his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise. Novak finds himself standing in front of the idealized ce Mounted beneath the glass is a shiny, perfect metal plaqu reading CARVER INDUSTRIAL EQUIPMENT, with a logo.  Novak recognizes it from the hoist in Stargher's basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. He pulls her to her feet.  Feeling betrayed and rejected, child breaks away from her.  THE ROAR OF STARGHER KING sh the cell.  Terrified, the boy searches for a place to hid

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Novak feels what's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't leave him! STARGHER KING APPEARS!  His throat wounded, bloody mess, descends out of dark nothingness, HOWLING with rage.  He reaches for Catherine, but Young Stargher runs in front o her.

dialogues.speaker: STARGHER KING CLAMPS HIS MASSIVE ARMS AROUND THE CHILD
dialogues.text: Little Carl opens his mouth in a silent scream... Catheri arms reach out to him, but Novak clasps her hand and pres And she is haunted by the sight of a frightened child in arms of a monster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry notices significant activity on the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're back. Everything happens fast.  He and Miriam frantically cease procedure.  Novak and Catherine are lowered and Novak startles them b quickly regaining consciousness.  Miriam attempts to inje him with stabilizing drugs, but he's already trying to te himself out of the apparatus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me out! Miriam MOVES into the PROCEDURE ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: GET ME OUT
dialogues.text: Miriam tries to follow protocol, but Novak is moving like fish caught in a net, ripping and tearing his way out of apparatus and suit.  He gets to his feet, but soon falls his knees, dizzy and disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move! Novak is not listening.  Fighting off any after-effects- physical and mental - he moves for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Novak! Catherine is coming back and Miriam moves to her.  Novak pauses just for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  But you're going to sit down right now.  I have to... Novak is already gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Novak speed-dials a number on speaker-phone, hurriedly dresses, and locates a photograph of Stargher's basement. When he hears someone pick up the line, he barks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Novak, who've I got? A confused Ramsey enters and listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A team of FBI AGENTS is meticulously going through every of Stargher's house.  Crisscrossed wooden beams have been laid across the pit allowing forensics experts to search without disturbing anything.  On the other end of the direct line is COLE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Cole. (INTERCUT WITH NOVAK AND RAMSEY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to find something in the basement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That hoist, with the winch... WE FOLLOW Cole as he moves to the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some kind of plaque, a metal plate, with a logo.  On the base. Cole locates it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carver Industrial Equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Novak instructs him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out the history of that machine.  Who bought it, used it, sold it.  And check Stargher's pay stubs.  I want to know every contractor he worked for.  I'm calling you from the chopper in ten minutes. Dizziness and disorientation again hit Novak.  Pale and sweating, he winces as his stomach agonizingly cramps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, man, you look like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Considering where I've been... Fighting the pain, he gathers together MAPS, slips on his shoes and grabs gun and holster.  Ramsey is apoplectic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa.  Mind telling me what the fuck is happening? Novak points to the photo of Stargher's basement, specifically the hoist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're bettin' the farm on something you saw after they pumped you full of god knows-what kind of shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw her.  Julia.  Alive.  I saw everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might've seen Jimmy Hoffa dancing with Timothy Leary.  I don't care. Novak is not stopping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, Miriam shines the penlight into Catherine's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a pocketful of rye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four and twenty blackbirds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baked in a pie. AT THE CONSOLE, on a security monitor, Henry can see Nova and Ramsey exiting down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI has left the building. IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, Miriam appears concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Novak.  I didn't get a chance to clear him. Catherine encourages her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.  I'm fine.  Go. As Miriam hurries to catch Novak, she tells Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep an eye on her. He nods, but isn't really paying attention.  Catherine tu to Stargher's motionless form, still suspended, still connected to the machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something, Julia. She looks around the room and runs her hands along the wa the tile, looking for a weak spot.  She focuses on the CEILING PANEL and although it's painful because of swolle fingers, removes her ENGAGEMENT RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ready-and-waiting HELICOPTER is on the pad.  Novak race out of the Center, Ramsey right behind him, SHOUTING at e other in order to hear above the chopper noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete, listen to me.  What did you really learn in there?  Anything new?  You really think Stargher gave you a save the-day clue?  What if this is all some kind of trick your head is playing on you? He won't consider that.  Novak climbs into the helicopter buckles himself in.  He looks to Ramsey - you coming? - Ramsey pats the side of the chopper and signals for the p to take off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry analyzes voluminous print-outs from the last proced Although his eyes are on the data, he converses with Catherine in the PROCEDURE ROOM via intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...there was a moment when we thought we'd lost Agent Novak as well. We see chemicals flow and computer programs initiate the procedure, but Henry is oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His post-procedure consciousness recovery was remarkably quick.  Never saw that before.  Hey, remember that one time... He JUMPS when the door to the procedure room SEALS SHUT a mechanisms HUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine? When he looks through the window, Catherine is again suspended, the procedure under way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? He types in a command, but nothing happens.  He tires aga On another keyboard, but gets no response.  When he looks the "map" screens, he sees something odd.  It's a small change, but it makes all the difference in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. THE CELL - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a rock climber in a crevasse, Julia shimmies up the walls of the cell by bracing herself in a corner and usin her hands and feet to push up.  The tile is slippery and movement precarious. She uses strength and balance to reach a position just be the Plexiglass, the fluorescent light bathing her in an e intense glow.  She sees a gap between the glass and the w and uses her ENGAGEMENT RING to dig into it, SCAPE, SCRAP SCRAPING with the diamond. THE SHOWER SPRAYS WATER!  Julia nearly loses her balance, manages to stay pressed into the corner.  She kicks the shower head, sending the spray as far from her as possibl and continues to dig at the caulking around the light fixture. IN THE OBSERVATION ROOM, we see something unexpected.  Th clock reads 00:00:00.  That water isn't going to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miriam and Ramsey return to the lab to find Henry anxious observing from the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flustered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She changed the codes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would take hours to re-route the system, and even if I did, I shouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Miriam analyzes the situation and regretfully, angrily, worriedly realizes what's happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's done it.  Stupid, stupid girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of going into his mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's bringing Stargher into hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bright, deliriously colorful realm visually reflective things we saw in Catherine's home.  Unusual trees, rock formations, totems, statues, and a brilliant POOL OF WATE The pond ripples.  Visible through the crystal-clear wate YOUNG STARGHER, rising to the surface like a drowning vic suddenly breaking through to air.  Panicked, he scrambles shore and pulls himself to land.  Although the place is comforting and beautiful, he's in strange territory and i frightens him.  Shivering, he hunches down, eyes darting way and that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all right, Carl. The boy turns toward the voice and finds CATHERINE, her h waving in the wind, skin glowing, eyes bright, cutting a magnificent figure in clothes that make her a warrior goddess.  She opens her arms and the boy runs to her, basking in th comfort of her embrace.  He shivers and she holds him tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, honey, you're with me now.  You're safe here. She looks deeply into his eyes and reassuringly explains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised I would help you, and I always keep my promises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can... Catherine is astonished and relieve to hear him speak.  A sad, trembling little voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I stay here? She is touched that he would ask and strokes his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regretfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...no, honey, I'm sorry.  It's doesn't work that way. The boy breaks away from her, turning his back.  She gent takes his hand but he yanks it free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if I told you you could come visit? He slowly turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make sure it happens, Carl.  I'll get them to let me do it.  And maybe... maybe we can... Young Stargher's eyes open wide with silent terror.  Over shoulder, she sees a SNAKE slither through the pool.  CENTIPEDES CRAWL over her legs and hair.  She stands and brushes them off.  The atmosphere grows darker and ominou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He found me... Catherine bristles as STARGHER KING RISES FROM THE POOL l a human serpent.  The brilliant colors of Catherine's wor fade to GRIM TONES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He always finds me. Stargher King SCREECHES with anger and confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where thiisss att?!?!  Me god no like id here... He snarls when he sees Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.  Priddy bish-hor-kund.  You big trubble-mekker... (sneers at the boy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you.  You cumm home now, liddle cogsugger worm.  Or me god haffa punish you... Young Stargher tightens his embrace of Catherine.  She st back, away from the pond, hugging the boy tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?!                        ?!?!? Stargher King laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoo you thing you are?? Himm Muther? He comes close and reaches for the boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gimme liddle worm. For a moment, Catherine appears frightened and intimidate Perhaps near an emotional breakdown.  But that is not the case.  She quietly lowers little Carl to the ground and whispers something in his ear.  As the boy nods, runs and hides, a ferocity grows within her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said no. Like a vengeful Valkyrie, she emits what can only be call BATTLE CRY!  STARGHER ATTACKS!  Arms reaching for her.  Catherine BLOCKS, PUNCHES, AND KICKS.  Stargher King doub over.  Catherine grabs his ears and pulls his face into h bent KNEE, breaking his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to my world. As blood flows from his nostrils, Stargher King grins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You funny.  You thing you stop me god? HE CHARGES.  At the right moment, Catherine sidesteps and SMASHES him in the ribs as he passes.  Stargher King crum to the ground and she KICKS an uppercut to this chin.  Ri from the mud and muck, Stargher King lands a POWERFUL BLO her head, sending her flying.  He lifts the stunned Cathe with one hand and pulls her face to his...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cum back wif me god.  You be good bish-hor-kund... Catherine looks into his soulless eyes.  Then SPITS in th and BITES his face!  She breaks free as he YOWLS with pai He steps toward her, but his feet don't move.  The earth itself appears to wrap around them and turn hard, like concrete.  Stargher King HOWLS with frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My world... A SHIMMERING KNIFE seems to enrage from within her forear out the flesh and into her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My rules. She SLASHES across his chest, drawing blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Catherine stops.  And turns to see the distraught Young Stargher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hurt him! She spins around and sees not Stargher King, but MARTIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't mean it.  I was bad. Disturbed by the transformation, Catherine backs away.  H vision blurs, the sound distorts.  And the earth cracks around Stargher King's ankles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He teached me a lesson.  I deserved it. Fighting feelings of disorientation, she kneels before th child and rests the knife on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one deserves it, Carl.  No one. She reaches out to him, but the child is JERKED into the by Stargher King.  In one hand, the monster holds little Carl.  In the other - a KNIFE.  His face and chest red wi crimson, Stargher King fixes his eyes on Catherine with a predator's stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yer world.  My knife. Stargher King raises the blade toward the boy's throat an SNAP!  The strong arms of an adult Stargher breaks his ar the elbow.  Both the knife and boy are dropped to the gro as Stargher King YOWLS like a stuck pig, the good arm cradling the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me god hurt!  Why you do that?  Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough. Stargher King regards him with disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enuff?!?! MARTIN STARGHER'S VOICE comes from the belly of the beast

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what's enough... Stargher and Stargher King square off.  The boy stands between them with the knife at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still speaking as Martin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up cunt. (to the boy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it here, worm... the child picks up the blade and stands between them, loo to Catherine for guidance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Martin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a mommy?  Is that what you want? In an almost dream-like motion, the child hands the blade adult Stargher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough. And he DRIVES the thing into Stargher King's heart.  For brief moment, Martin's face is superimposed over Stargher King's.  Stunned, he slumps and regards adult Stargher wi sad, troubled eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Stargher King)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  What'd I do?... Stargher TWISTS the handle of the blade and Martin/Stargh King drops dead.   Dead.  Young Stargher smiles and hugs Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to go 'way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl...? The boy runs to adult Stargher who lifts the child into h arms and holds him close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. She looks to adult Stargher and begins to understand.  He descends into the pool, the boy resting his head on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Catherine.  You did help me.  More than you'll ever know. Man and boy disappear beneath the water's surface.  Cathe stands and sees that Stargher King's body has vanished.  She walks to the shore and sees, deep underwater, Starghe and little Carl floating lifelessly like women in the cel And FADE FROM VIEW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye Carl. She presses the sensor in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE CONTROL ROOM, Miriam is shocked by what she sees o the monitors and looks at Stargher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in full arrest. Catherine quietly returns to consciousness and is automatically lowered.  She pulls the mask from her face, rises and opens the door.  Miriam races inside and desperately attempts to revive Stargher.  But it's no use Angry and stunned, she demands of Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me! But Catherine chooses not to.  She knows Carl Stargher wi never return to the world of the living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper roars across the sky.  As they head northeast away from the urban and toward the rural, Novak gazes out window, trying to stay focused, fighting any after-effect the drugs.  The pilot communicates via headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Novak?  Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole and a handful of other agents pour into waiting Suburbans.  (INTERCUT WITH NOVAK IN HELICOPTER).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hoist was manufactured by Carver Industrial Equipment in 1982.  Serial number 117-337J.  Purchased by a boat shop in Lake Havasu, but sold to Lattimer's industrial Supply in 1992...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water is near the ceiling.  Kicking her legs to keep afloat, Julia DIGS with the ring and we see she has creat gap between the light fixture housing and an unused PIPE leading to the surface.  She pushes, but can't get anythi to move.  The opening will get no bigger.  Julia sucks th last bit of oxygen and swims to the bottom of the cell.  Searching for something, she finds a juice box and pulls the drinking straw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaken, but oddly transcendent, Catherine watches as Stargher's body is wheeled out of the lab on a gurney.  S comforts a whimpering Valentine and tells him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's alright now, Valentine.  I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Novak scans the topography of FARMS below, listening to a report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole is the passenger, on the radio to Novak, A DRIVER ne to him, doing about a hundred down the Interstate, SIREN blaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lattimer sold the hoist to a guy named Bainbridge who tired to build a machine works out near Delano.  Bainbridge ends up in bankruptcy court and the state winds up with the land - it's just sitting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delano?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.  And guess who they hired to seal up the place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never kid.  My wife hates it.  Says I'm too serious. Novak locates Delano on the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The exact location, Cole.  Give it to me. The pilot grins and pushes the copper to top speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia is entirely underwater but alive.  She uses the str to suck oxygen through the gap in the ceiling, but it's difficult to tread water and her lungs are aching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Novak uses binoculars to scan farmland.  He searches.  An there it is: The abandoned farmhouse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia tries to hold herself up by pressing her arms and l against the walls, but as she does, the straw slips from mouth.  She reaches for it, but only succeeds in pushing away from her.  It heads for the drain.  And disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter lands and Novak jumps out.  He knows this the place.  He runs into the barn, but there's nothing, n sign of her.  The pilot looks at him with a true sense of loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Julia desperately tires to find the straw through the holes of the drain, we see for the first time an expressi which tells us she's given up.  THUMP-THUMP-THUMP.  The c starts to vibrate.  A repetitive noise WHUP-WHUP-WHUP - c from above.  She swims to the top of the cell and POUNDS the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighting exhaustion and the side effects of the drugs, No pushes on.  Think, Peter, think... His eyes find the WATE TANKS and he SHOUTS at the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut the engine! As the motor dies, Novak listens and listens.  There it i Water pipes beneath his feet.  And very faintly, a poundi He follows the sound, searching the earth.  It's clearer louder.  Novak tosses aside rusted junk and the pilot run assist him.  Together, they expose the entrance to the underground sanctuary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Novak drops to the floor below.  Instantly affected by th similarities and the differences to the idealized cell of Stargher's mind, he feels another wave of dizziness, but pushes on. And is hit hard by the sight of DROWNED JULIA, her motion body floating past him.  HER EYES OPEN and bubbles drift her nose and mouth.  Novak BANGS on the Plexiglas and cal to her.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: The thick Plexiglass still remains, but she now can see h Novak pulls his ID BADGE and smacks it against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: MOVE ASIDE
dialogues.text: He pulls his gun and takes aim.  Julia swims to the top o the cell and presses herself against the ceiling.  BANG-B BANG-BANG-BANG-BANG.  Novak fires a circle of shots into thick plastic.  Water slowly leaks, but the damn thing is still solid.  He lifts the industrial VCR and RAMS it at bullet-damaged section.  CRACK! CRASH!  WATER POURS FROM CELL.  Julia's body descends on the torrent of water.  No reaches inside and pulls her to safety.  He's just about give her CPR when she coughs, sputters, and thirstily dri in oxygen.  Holding her tightly, Novak sinks to the floor the water from the cell spilling everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole's Suburban leads a contingent of FBI vehicles and lo police cars onto the property, sirens blaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing the sirens, Novak relaxes.  For the first time in knows how long, he relaxes.  And holds Julia Hickson as i his life depended on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two cars parked outside.  An old, quirky Volvo and a Land Rover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a television plays THE WIZARD OF OZ, we find Catherine watching the movie from the couch, sitting up, drinking a of tea.  She looks rested and quite cute in gym shorts an T-shirt, her CAT sleeping next to her.  IN THE KITCHEN, Miriam packs up her stethoscope and blood pressure monito moves into the living room as Dorothy falls asleep in a f of poppies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left the nutritional information on the fridge door.  Read it. Catherine nods, but she's more interested in the movie.  Miriam deposits prescription bottles onto a side table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I refilled the Zyprexa and Atavan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need them anymore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But she leaves them just the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come by tomorrow after work.  With dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Miriam.  Say hi to Henry and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...give a kiss to Edward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give a kiss to Edward. The women exchange smiles and Miriam exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Miriam walks to her Land Rover, she sees a government issue Suburban park on the street and Peter Novak exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Novak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Kent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks you.  Six weeks off does a body good. (conspiratorially)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard she got the approval to try the reversal with Edward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federal Bureau of Investigation, ma'am.  We know all, see all... Novak opens the rear compartment of the Suburban and we h something moving inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awaiting his arrival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the cat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Completely unaware. Miriam's pager BEEPS and she hurries to her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go.  Good luck. Novak smiles, waves goodbye, and reaches into the Suburba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dorothy and her companions confront the Wizard, there' KNOCK at the screen door and Catherine sees Novak waiting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready? Catherine cradles her cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready. He opens the door and escorts a leashed VALENTINE into th living room.  Catherine's cat squirms from her arms and h under the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That went well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give her a minute. (smiles at the dog)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Valentine. Novak unleashes the albino Shepherd and he runs to Cather licking her face, wagging his tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. (calling for the cat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abigail... Valentine picks up the cat's scent and sniffs around the of the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard Julia and John got married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.  Eloped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for them. Valentine settles on the floor.  Slowly, Abigail's curios gets the best of her and she creeps out, sniffing the dog nose.  Patient and sweet, Valentine lies still, allowing cat to reach an acceptable level of comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you.  You have to be optimistic.  Believe in them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you say. Amazingly, Abigail brushes up against the dog and purrs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All yours.  My boss says it's one of the strangest requests the Bureau's ever had. Catherine laughs.  She likes that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He also says that until proven differently, Julia Hickson was found as a result of good old-fashioned detective work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I think it does. (genuine concern)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Catherine... If you ever want to talk about it.  What happened to Stargher.  That last time. It's painfully clear the thought of it still troubles her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just yet.  Okay? Novak doesn't push it.  He just takes her hand and gives gentle squeeze.  The cat dashes into the kitchen and Valentine follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it. He moves into the kitchen.  In a moment of quiet introspection, Catherine looks at the television screen, Dorothy accidentally hitting the wicked Witch with a buck of water, causing her to melt.  And she looks away, unabl watch, disturbed by the image.  She turns to the kitchen sees Novak feeding an appreciative dog and cat.  He rises returns to the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Thank you. He smiles and nods, gently resting his hand on her should Catherine shuts her eyes and leans toward him, comforted simple human touch...
